headline: American Water Announces Quarterly Dividend
summary: CAMDEN, N.J., October 28, 2025--American Water Works Company, Inc. (NYSE: AWK) announced that its board of directors today declared a quarterly cash dividend payment of $0.8275 per share of common stock, payable on December 2, 2025, to all shareholders of record as of November 13, 2025.

headline: New Jersey American Water Breaks Ground on New Operations Center in Washington
summary: WASHINGTON, N.J., October 28, 2025--New Jersey American Water officially broke ground today on a new operations center in Washington, marking a significant investment in infrastructure, service reliability and resiliency for customers and communities in Warren and Morris counties. The event was attended by Assemblyman Erik Peterson of Legislative District 23; Louann Cox, mayor of Washington Borough; George Willan, deputy mayor of Washington Township (Warren County); and Carolyn Gallagher, aide t

headline: American Water Charitable Foundation and Illinois American Water Award over $40,000 to Support Accessible Drinking Water
summary: BELLEVILLE, Ill., October 28, 2025--The American Water Charitable Foundation, a philanthropic non-profit organization established by American Water (NYSE: AWK), the largest regulated water and wastewater utility company in the U.S., and Illinois American Water, announced today that the Foundation has awarded $40,400 in grants to 12 eligible public charities and school districts, to fund bottle filling stations through its Hydration Station Grant Program. headline: AWWA releases white paper to help water utilities plan for data centers
summary: Communities and water utilities grappling with the impacts and opportunities introduced by data centers have a new strategic resource at their disposal, after the American Water Works Association (AWWA) released a white paper titled Cooling the Cloud: Water Utilities in a Data-Driven World.

raw.headline: AWWA releases white paper to help water utilities plan for data centers

headline: How Recent Developments Are Shaping the Story and Valuation of American Water Works
summary: American Water Works Company’s price target has seen a modest increase, with the Fair Value Estimate rising from $141.11 to $143.78 per share. This adjustment reflects a balance of cautious optimism within the utilities sector, supported by steady demand and a favorable regulatory backdrop. Stay tuned to find out how investors can remain informed as the company’s narrative continues to evolve. What Wall Street Has Been Saying Recent analyst commentary on American Water Works Company...

headline: California American Water Continues $1.4 Million Meter Installation Project in the Fruitridge Vista Water District
summary: SACRAMENTO, Calif., October 28, 2025--California American Water is continuing work on a $1.4 million infrastructure project in the Fruitridge Vista Water District, where crews are installing new water meters at residential properties. This project began in late September and will continue through mid-January 2026, bringing modern metering to customers and their homes.

headline: American Water Works: Little Appeal Following Merger Potential
summary: American Water Works (AWK) is a high-quality, A-rated water utility with a strong history but faces valuation and CapEx headwinds.
